com.whirvis.jraknet.client.peer

Class PeerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.client.peer.PeerFactory

  • public final class PeerFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Used by the RakNetClient to create a RakNetServerPeer.
    Since:
    JRakNet v2.0.0
    Author:
    Trent Summerlin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.net.InetSocketAddress address 
      private io.netty.channel.Channel channel 
      private RakNetClient client 
      private ConnectionType connectionType 
      private int factoryState 
      private long guid 
      private int initialMaximumTransferUnit 
      private org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger log 
      private int maximumMaximumTransferUnit 
      private int maximumTransferUnit 
      private static int STATE_FIRST_CONNECTION_REQUEST
      The factory needs to send a OPEN_CONNECTION_REQUEST_1 packet and get a OPEN_CONNECTION_RESPONSE_1 packet in order to proceed to the next state.
      private static int STATE_IDLE
      The factory is not currently in the process of doing anything.
      private static int STATE_PEER_ASSEMBLED
      The peer has been assembled.
      private static int STATE_SECOND_CONNECTION_REQUEST
      The factory needs to send a OPEN_CONNECTION_REQUEST_2 packet and get a OPEN_CONNECTION_RESPONSE_2 packet in response to finish peer creation.
      private java.lang.Throwable throwable

    • Constructor Detail

      • PeerFactory

        public PeerFactory(RakNetClient client,
                   java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
                   io.netty.channel.Channel channel,
                   int initialMaximumTransferUnit,
                   int maximumMaximumTransferUnit)
            throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates a peer factory.
        Parameters:
        client - the client connecting to the server.
        address - the address of the server.
        channel - the channel that to use when creating the peer.
        initialMaximumTransferUnit - the initial maximum transfer unit size.
        maximumMaximumTransferUnit - the maximum transfer unit with the highest size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the client, address or IP address are null.

    • Method Detail

      • getAddress

        public java.net.InetSocketAddress getAddress()
        Returns the address of the server that the peer is being assembled for.
        Returns:
        the address of the server that the peer is being assembled for.

      • exceptionCaught

        public void exceptionCaught(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                            java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Called when an exception is caused by the server that the peer is being assembled for. This will cause the startAssembly(MaximumTransferUnit[]) method to throw the Throwable specified here.
        Parameters:
        throwable - the Throwable the server caused to be thrown.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the throwable is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the peer is not currently being assembled, or has already been assembled.

      • startAssembly

        public void startAssembly(MaximumTransferUnit[] units)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          PeerFactoryException,
                          PacketBufferException
        Starts peer assembly.

        This will block the thread. However, packets will still be received by Netty. When a packet has been received, it should be sent back to the factory using the assemble(RakNetPacket) method.

        Parameters:
        units - the maximum transfer units the client will attempt to use with the server.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the units are null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the peer has already been assembled or is currently being assembled.
        PeerFactoryException - if an error occurs when assembling the peer. It is possible for this method to throw a PeerFactoryException through the exceptionCaught(Throwable) method. Any exception caught in the assemble(RakNetPacket) method will be routed back and thrown here through this method.
        PacketBufferException - if encoding or decoding one of the packets fails.

      • assemble

        public RakNetServerPeer assemble(RakNetPacket packet)
                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Further assembles the peer creation by handling the specified packet.
        Parameters:
        packet - the packet to handle.
        Returns:
        the created peer, null if the peer is not yet finished assembling.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the packet is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the peer is not currently being assembled or if the peer has already been assembled.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
